Biriyani.Key Vitamins & Minerals: Iron (2.5 mg), B Vitamins (Niacin: 5 mg, B6: 0.5 mg), Phosphorus (150 mg)
Biriyani.Pregnancy Benefits: Rich in iron to help manage anemia, especially when paired with vitamin C-rich foods. Provides protein and energy for overall health. B vitamins support nerve function and fetal development. Phosphorus is essential for bone health and energy production.
Biriyani.Risks: High in calories and fat, which may contribute to weight gain and exacerbate hypertension. High sodium content from spices can be a concern for blood pressure. May contain hidden nuts due to cross-contamination, which could trigger an allergic reaction.
Biriyani.Best Ways to Eat: Opt for a homemade version with less oil, more vegetables, and lean meats. Pair with a side of raita (yogurt) for probiotics and a salad for fiber and vitamins. Ensure it is prepared without nuts to avoid allergic reactions. Practice portion control to manage calorie intake.
